definition: to rehabilitate/to regain one's good name
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: The People's Liberation Army should recognize its failings and restore its prestige through its own efforts.
sentences.chinese: 我们解放军要有自知之明，要靠自己恢复名誉。

sentences.english: Not untill 1982 was he rehabilitated his fame.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯直到1982年才被恢复名誉。

sentences.english: There are occasions when you might find it too difficult to restore your reputation.
sentences.chinese: 当发现恢复名誉非常困难时，机会也仍然还是有的。

sentences.english: The resourceful jurist formed a plan to recover his own laurels .
sentences.chinese: 足智多谋的法学家已经想出了一个恢复名誉的计策。

sentences.english: He tried to rehabilitate himself with his boss.
sentences.chinese: 他想从老板那里恢复名誉。

definition: to redress (an injustice)/to rehabilitate (sb whose reputation was unjustly sullied)
to reverse a verdict/to present different views on a historical person or verdict
to exonerate/to clear (from an accusation)/to rehabilitate
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
restored to one's official post/to send sb back to his former post
